description: a(n) contains n digits (either '1' or '4') and is divisible by 2^n.
formula: a(n)=a(n-1)+10^(n-1)*(4-3*[a(n-1)/2^(n-1) mod 2]) i.e. a(n) ends with a(n-1); if (n-1)-th term is divisible by 2^n then n-th term begins with a 2, if not then n-th term begins with a 7.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 06 2000
